title: WHIRLING F3 / FOOTPRINTS IN THE DUST
description:
1. See tracks from what seem to be boots.
2. Reveals not odd-soled if you return after suspecting Ruby. (Anti-red-herring.)

dialogueTree.title: Footprints in the Dust: "You *clearly* see footprints in the..."
dialogueTree.text: You *clearly* see footprints in the downy carpet of dust covering the workshop floor.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Jackpot." The lieutenant takes out..."
links.text: "Jackpot." The lieutenant takes out his notebook. "These, unlike everything else here, are *new*."

links.title: You: "Someone's been back here -- *recent..."
links.text: Someone's been back here -- *recently*.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Three weeks maximum -- from the du..."
links.text: "Three weeks maximum -- from the dust coverage. It could easily have been *one* week too. You know, officer..." He looks at you.

links.title: Empathy: "This is so good it makes him forget..."
links.text: This is so good it makes him forget the whole *Kimball* memory.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was a *stereo-investigation* af..."
links.text: "It was a *stereo-investigation* after all. It has now converged with our main investigation. Adding a new fact to *consider*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The blue door was a *mega*-investi..."
links.text: "The blue door was a *mega*-investigation after all -- it has now converged with our main investigation, which I would say is *quite* large."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This isn't bad at all -- it was a..."
links.text: "This isn't bad at all -- it was a *good* idea to see where that door leads. Commendable work bringing us to this place."

links.title: Empathy: "This is good. He likes it. That's a..."
links.text: This is good. He likes it. That's a little smile there -- in the dark of the workshop.

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "The dust has not settled again wher..."
links.text: The dust has not settled again where these footprints have been made. The displacement in this dusty hell tells a story.

links.title: You: "What does this *mean*?"
links.text: What does this *mean*?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It means someone snuck through wha..."
links.text: "It means someone snuck through what seems like a *secret route* -- leading to the roof. The roof, from where you can *shoot* our victim. This is significant."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""These prints, officer, could be th..."
links.text: "These prints, officer, could be the prints of our killer. And if not -- at least they're a good argument for this *Ruby* doing it. To present to Titus."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It means someone snuck through wha..."
links.text: "It means someone snuck through what seems like a secret route -- leading to the roof. From where you can *shoot* our victim. This is significant."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""These prints, officer -- could be..."
links.text: "These prints, officer -- could be the prints of our killer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It means someone snuck through wha..."
links.text: "It means someone snuck through what seems like a secret route -- behind our rape victim's room. In the recent weeks. This may prove to be significant."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It means someone snuck through wha..."
links.text: "It means someone snuck through what seems like a secret route -- behind our rape victim's room. In the recent weeks. This may prove to be significant."

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "Neither the footprints nor the dust..."
links.text: Neither the footprints nor the dust speak their secrets. But you know: it means that someone has been back *here*.

links.title: You: "Crouch, study the footprints."
links.text: Crouch, study the footprints.

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "Large prints, most likely made by b..."
links.text: Large prints, most likely made by boots. The size is hard to determine (sole could be bigger than vamp). The soles have left a pattern -- uniform, horizontal lines.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "One person has been here. They've g..."
links.text: One person has been here. They've gone back and forth. The tips point both ways.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "This print is unlike one left by a..."
links.text: This print is unlike one left by a regular worker boot. It is not a *brand* sole, with logos on it. It seems custom made or old fashioned.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Shoe size is 41-42, maybe 43. It co..."
links.text: Shoe size is 41-42, maybe 43. It could be a large-footed woman or a small-to-average-footed man. This is, unfortunately, the worst, most vague shoe size there is.

links.title: Half Light: "Of course! Damn..."
links.text: Of course! Damn...

links.title: You: ""The prints look like one person we..."
links.text: "The prints look like one person went back and forth."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Between that," he points to the el..."
links.text: "Between that," he points to the elevator doors in the corner, "and that," he points to the barred door.

links.title: You: ""This print doesn't look like the O..."
links.text: "This print doesn't look like the Odd-soled print we found at the hanging, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He inspects the tracks closer. "The..."
links.text: He inspects the tracks closer. "The size looks about the same, actually. They're not the same *shoe*, but they *could* be the same person."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't rule out Ruby coming he..."
links.text: "I wouldn't rule out Ruby coming here yet. This isn't an argument against her. People change shoes, you know. But it's not argument *for* her either."

links.title: You: ""This doesn't look like the workers..."
links.text: "This doesn't look like the workers boots from the hanging, does it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. These little... horizontal lin..."
links.text: "No. These little... horizontal lines are different. They look custom made to me. Or some kind of foreign print? Hard to say. Still a *boot* though."

links.title: You: "Get up. (Conclude.)"
links.text: Get up. (Conclude.)

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "Everything around you is quiet. The..."
links.text: Everything around you is quiet. The prints criss-cross the workshop floor.

links.title: You: "One person went back and forth."
links.text: One person went back and forth.

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "The footprints go up the length of..."
links.text: The footprints go up the length of the room and back down. That is all they do.

links.title: You: "This print doesn't look like the Od..."
links.text: This print doesn't look like the Odd Sole.

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "The footprints are of one type. The..."
links.text: The footprints are of one type. They do not congratulate you for correctly recognizing what type they are not.

links.title: You: "This doesn't look like the workers..."
links.text: This doesn't look like the workers boots from the hanging, does it?

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "The footprints do not speak. They s..."
links.text: The footprints do not speak. They simply exist here, a product of the dust; just as the footprints outside are a product of the mud and apparently different shoes.

links.title: You: "Get up."
links.text: Get up.

links.title: Footprints in the Dust: "The footprints are still there. The..."
links.text: The footprints are still there. They have told their story.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
